item.title: By: Alan Brill
item.dc:creator: Alan Brill
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2009/11/29/lord-jonathan-sacks-on-the-siddur/#comment-261">tzvee</a>.
I assume it was taken from a book describing the virtues of "The Book of Common Prayer." A high church service with its build up to Glory and Agnus Dei followed by the antiphonals can be described as a symphony.

item.title: By: tzvee
item.dc:creator: tzvee
item.description: ok so two people have read that now. what drove me crazy at the outset was his prayer is a symphony metaphor. so much so that in my closing class for my jts liturgy course i outlined for the students a three act opera based on the shacharit just to show how much off the mark sack's genre choice was for his metaphoric riff.
